1.text: My son, pay attention to my wisdom. Turn your ear to my understanding:

2.text: that you may maintain discretion, that your lips may preserve knowledge.

3.text: For the lips of an adulteress drip honey. Her mouth is smoother than oil,

4.text: But in the end she is as bitter as wormwood, and as sharp as a two-edged sword.

5.text: Her feet go down to death. Her steps lead straight to Sheol.

6.text: She gives no thought to the way of life. Her ways are crooked, and she doesn’t know it.

7.text: Now therefore, my sons, listen to me. Don’t depart from the words of my mouth.

8.text: Remove your way far from her. Don’t come near the door of her house,

9.text: lest you give your honor to others, and your years to the cruel one;

10.text: lest strangers feast on your wealth, and your labors enrich another man’s house.

11.text: You will groan at your latter end, when your flesh and your body are consumed,

12.text: and say, “How I have hated instruction, and my heart despised reproof;

13.text: neither have I obeyed the voice of my teachers, nor turned my ear to those who instructed me!

14.text: I have come to the brink of utter ruin, in the midst of the gathered assembly.”

15.text: Drink water out of your own cistern, running water out of your own well.

16.text: Should your springs overflow in the streets, streams of water in the public squares?

17.text: Let them be for yourself alone, not for strangers with you.

18.text: Let your spring be blessed. Rejoice in the wife of your youth.

19.text: A loving doe and a graceful deer—let her breasts satisfy you at all times. Be captivated always with her love.

20.text: For why should you, my son, be captivated with an adulteress? Why embrace the bosom of another?

21.text: For the ways of man are before the eyes of Yahweh. He examines all his paths.

22.text: The evil deeds of the wicked ensnare him. The cords of his sin hold him firmly.

23.text: He will die for lack of instruction. In the greatness of his folly, he will go astray.
